text:
Here is a piece of .htaccess I'm using:

Action throw /index.php
ForceType throw

I expect now that all requests to this directory will be processed by index.php.
This scheme worked well in Apache 1.x but it doesn't work in Apache 2: instead 
of processing request in index.php Apache generates 404 error.

I'm not sure if this is a bug but i couldn't find any info related to this 
problem so i decided to make a bug report.
creator: xorax@mail.ru

text:
If you were using a remotely recent version of 2.x, you would have the virtual
option to Action to get what you want.  Otherwise, you can use ScriptAliasMatch
to accomplish the same thing.
creator: slive@apache.org
xorax@mail.ru
text:
I've installed Apache 2.0.59 and 'Action' still doesn't work. If I understand

'ScriptAliasMatch' does not fit my needs since it's impossible to use it in

Have you checked the docs?

Look for the "virtual" option, as I mentioned before.
